Detailed Description

template<class eltype>
class YAIsoReduce< eltype >

Dimensionality reduction using IsoMap.

This implements the IsoMap dimensionality reduction routine in:

J. B. Tenenbaum, V. de Silva, and J. C. Langford, Science, 290, 2319 (2000).

Find how many connected components and their sizes result from neighboring.

Same as component_stat() but landmarks can be specified. *

Find how many connected components and their sizes result from neighboring.

Parameters:
n x m input matrix for n datapoints with a dimensionality = m
num_neighbors number of neighbors to use for neighboring routine
stat length C vector containing the sizes of the C connected components found during neighboring. *

Find the reduction based on initial samples.

Parameters:
input Matrix storing initial samples (columns are dimensions)
output Matrix storing low-dimensioal coords of samples
dim New dimensionality for output matrix *

ya_type2 &  output,
ya_sizet  dim,
EigenOptions &  eigopts,
ya_type3 &  landmarks
) 
 

Find the reduction based on initial samples using landmarks.

Parameters:
input Matrix storing initial coordinates
output Matrix storing low-dimensioal coords of samples
dim New dimensionality for output matrix
landmarks Vector storing indices of landmark points in input
Note:
if more than 1 connected manifold is found, landmarks will store the subset of landmarks in the connected manifold *
